author: Leslie Brody
title: After 23 Years, Newark Regains Control of Its Schools
text:
Newark reclaimed control of its public schools Thursday with whoops, hugs and a “FirstDay” hashtag, ending 23 years of state takeover aimed at fixing its long troubled system.
Teenagers who had marched in rallies over the years demanding local control said they were relieved. Parents said they were happy to get a more direct say in their children’s education. And Mayor Ras Baraka, a Democrat who campaigned in 2014 calling for an end to state intervention, took a victory lap just months before his re-election bid in May.
